title: Experimental Data of Cascade Experiments in Genomics
text: https://doi.org/10.32614/CRAN.package.bigalgebra goal CascadeData provide experimental data GSE39411 ready use format. Vallat L, Kemper CA, Jung N, Maumy-Bertrand M, Bertrand F, …, Bahram S, (2013), “Reverse-engineering genetic circuitry cancer cell predicted intervention chronic lymphocytic leukemia”. Proc Natl Acad Sci USA, 110(2):459-64, https://dx.doi.org/10.1073/pnas.1211130110. featured examples packages Cascade one, modeling tool allowing gene selection, reverse engineering, prediction cascade networks. (Jung, N., Bertrand, F., Bahram, S., Vallat, L., Maumy-Bertrand, M., 2014, https://dx.doi.org/10.1093/bioinformatics/btt705). website examples created F. Bertrand M. Maumy-Bertrand.

title: Experimental Data of Cascade Experiments in Genomics
text: can install released version CascadeData CRAN : can install development version CascadeData github :

title: Experimental Data of Cascade Experiments in Genomics
text: Two data frames 54613 probesets repeated measurements 6 independent subjects 4 time points. preliminary group comparison. First create grouping factor. , create 2 discriminative components (probeset linear combinaison, .e. scores) featuring 100 probesets using sparse partial least squares discrimant analysis mixOmics package, doi:10.18129/B9.bioc.mixOmics. optimal choice number components number kept genes can carried using cross-validation. First makes sure mixOmics Bioconductor package installed. Create clustered image map (cim, .e. heat map) represent results splsda analysis. plot chunk cim Retrieve names probesets selected create 2 splsda components First makes sure limma Bioconductor package installed. Using limma, doi:10.18129/B9.bioc.limma, plotMDS function create multidimensional scaling plot distances probeset expression profiles selected using splsda. plot chunk plotMDS

title: Experimental Data of Cascade Experiments in Genomics
text: jetset package enables selection optimal probe sets HG-U95Av2, HG-U133A, HG-U133 Plus 2.0, U133 X3P microarray platforms. requires org.Hs.eg.db Bioconductor package, doi:10.18129/B9.bioc.org.Hs.eg.db. First makes sure jetset CRAN package org.Hs.eg.db Bioconductor package installed. Retrieve optimal probesets given Entrez GeneID. Select optimal probesets datasets given Entrez GeneID. , create 2 discriminative components (probeset linear combinaison, .e. scores) featuring 100 probesets using sparse partial least squares discrimant analysis mixOmics package, doi:10.18129/B9.bioc.mixOmics. optimal choice number components number kept genes can carried using cross-validation. First makes sure mixOmics Bioconductor package installed. Create clustered image map (cim, .e. heat map) represent results splsda analysis. plot chunk cimjetset Retrieve Entrez GeneIDs selected create 2 splsda components First makes sure limma Bioconductor package installed. Using limma, doi:10.18129/B9.bioc.limma, plotMDS function create multidimensional scaling plot distances Entrez GeneID expression profiles selected using splsda. plot chunk plotMDSegid
code: if (!requireNamespace("org.Hs.eg.db", quietly = TRUE)){   if (!requireNamespace("BiocManager", quietly = TRUE)){       install.packages("BiocManager")     }   BiocManager::install("org.Hs.eg.db", version = "3.8") } if (!requireNamespace("jetset", quietly = TRUE)){   install.packages("jetset") } library(jetset) resjetset=jetset::jmap("hgu133plus2", eg = sort(unique(scores.hgu133plus2$EntrezID))) micro_S_jetset<-micro_S[resjetset,] rownames(micro_S_jetset)<-names(resjetset) micro_US_jetset<-micro_US[resjetset,] rownames(micro_US_jetset)<-names(resjetset) modsplsda_jetset=mixOmics::splsda(t(cbind(micro_S_jetset,micro_US_jetset)),  groupf, ncomp = 2, keepX = c(100, 100)) mixOmics::cim(modsplsda_jetset) selectedEntrezGeneIDs<-unique(mixOmics::selectVar(modsplsda_jetset)$name, mixOmics::selectVar(modsplsda, comp=2)$name) if (!requireNamespace("limma", quietly = TRUE)){   if (!requireNamespace("BiocManager", quietly = TRUE)){     install.packages("BiocManager")     }   BiocManager::install("limma") } limma::plotMDS(cbind(micro_S,micro_US)[selectedEntrezGeneIDs,])

what: CascadeData: Experimental Data of Cascade Experiments in Genomics — CascadeData-package
title: CascadeData: Experimental Data of Cascade Experiments in Genomics — CascadeData-package
text: experimental expression data (5 leukemic 'CLL' B-lymphocyte aggressive form 'GSE39411', doi:10.1073/pnas.1211130110 ), B-cell receptor stimulation, used examples packages 'Cascade' one, modeling tool allowing gene selection, reverse engineering, prediction cascade networks. Jung, N., Bertrand, F., Bahram, S., Vallat, L., Maumy-Bertrand, M. (2014) doi:10.1093/bioinformatics/btt705 .

title: CascadeData: Experimental Data of Cascade Experiments in Genomics — CascadeData-package
text: Jung, N., Bertrand, F., Bahram, S., Vallat, L., Maumy-Bertrand, M. (2013). Cascade: R-package study, predict simulate diffusion signal temporal gene network. Bioinformatics, btt705. Vallat, L., Kemper, C. ., Jung, N., Maumy-Bertrand, M., Bertrand, F., ... & Bahram, S. (2013). Reverse-engineering genetic circuitry cancer cell predicted intervention chronic lymphocytic leukemia. Proceedings National Academy Sciences, 110(2), 459-464.

title: CascadeData: Experimental Data of Cascade Experiments in Genomics — CascadeData-package
text: package written Frederic Bertrand, Myriam Maumy-Bertrand Nicolas Jung biological insights Laurent Vallat. Maintainer: Frederic Bertrand <frederic.bertrand@lecnam.net>

title: Stimulated dataset — micro_S
text: stimulated data part GSE39411 dataset, https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/geo/query/acc.cgi?acc=GSE39411. Data normalized ready use.

title: Stimulated dataset — micro_S
text: data frame 54613 probesets measured 6 times throught 4 time points. features 54613 rows 24 numeric columns. Columns named **exactly** : N1_S_T60, N1_S_T90, N1_S_T210, N1_S_T390, N2_S_T60, N2_S_T90, N2_S_T210, N2_S_T390, N3_S_T60, N3_S_T90, N3_S_T210, N3_S_T390, N4_S_T60, N4_S_T90, N4_S_T210, N4_S_T390, N5_S_T60, N5_S_T90, N5_S_T210, N5_S_T390, N6_S_T60, N6_S_T90, N6_S_T210, N6_S_T390. ordering strict: replicate N1, N2, N3, N4 , N5, N6 time points ordered T60, T90, T210, T390.

title: Stimulated dataset — micro_S
text: 5 leukemic CLL B-lymphocyte aggressive form stimulated vitro anti-IgM antibody, activating B-cell receptor (BCR). analyzed gene expression 4 time points (60, 90, 210 390 minutes). gene expression measurement performed stimulated cells control unstimulated cells. stimulated cells dataset. Data collected HG-U133_Plus_2, Affymetrix Human Genome U133 Plus 2.0 Array.

title: Stimulated dataset — micro_S
text: Vallat, L., Kemper, C. ., Jung, N., Maumy-Bertrand, M., Bertrand, F., ..., Bahram, S. (2013). Reverse-engineering genetic circuitry cancer cell predicted intervention chronic lymphocytic leukemia. Proceedings National Academy Sciences, 110(2), 459-464, doi:10.1073/pnas.1211130110 .

title: Unstimulated control dataset — micro_US
text: unstimulated data part GSE39411 dataset, https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/geo/query/acc.cgi?acc=GSE39411. Data normalized ready use.

title: Unstimulated control dataset — micro_US
text: data frame 54613 probesets measured 6 times throught 4 time points. features 54613 rows 24 numeric columns. Columns named **exactly** : N1_US_T60, N1_US_T90, N1_US_T210, N1_US_T390, N2_US_T60, N2_US_T90, N2_US_T210, N2_US_T390, N3_US_T60, N3_US_T90, N3_US_T210, N3_US_T390, N4_US_T60, N4_US_T90, N4_US_T210, N4_US_T390, N5_US_T60, N5_US_T90, N5_US_T210, N5_US_T390, N6_US_T60, N6_US_T90, N6_US_T210, N6_US_T390. ordering strict: replicate N1, N2, N3, N4 , N5, N6 time points ordered T60, T90, T210, T390. data frame 54613 probesets measured 6 times throught 4 time points.

title: Unstimulated control dataset — micro_US
text: 5 leukemic CLL B-lymphocyte aggressive form stimulated vitro anti-IgM antibody, activating B-cell receptor (BCR). analyzed gene expression 4 time points (60, 90, 210 390 minutes). gene expression measurement performed stimulated cells control unstimulated cells. unstimulated cells dataset. Data collected HG-U133_Plus_2, Affymetrix Human Genome U133 Plus 2.0 Array.
